image.altText: A large fire on the roof of a factory, shown from the air.

props.synopsis: A factory fire sparked by a chemical explosion has been brought under control, but authorities say they expect it to burn for days.

title.children: 'Fireball' explosions and flying debris seen at site of Melbourne factory fire

image.altText: A large tree limb on top of a car with emergency crew standing by.

props.synopsis: Judith Ditter was travelling with her daughter and two others along an Adelaide hills road when a heavy tree branch fell on the vehicle and killed her. A coronial inquest has begun, with the court hearing better investigation and management of the tree may have saved her life.

title.children: Woman's death from falling tree branch 'may have been preventable', court hears

image.altText: In a sequence of images, a young Indigenous teen is held down and struck with a baton by police.

props.synopsis: 7.30 has obtained footage showing police beating an Indigenous youth repeatedly with a baton in a watch house, sparking allegations of excessive use of force.

title.children: 'Abhorrent and distressing': Multiple police beat teenager locked in watch house

image.altText: boat

props.synopsis: Fresh claims of boat turnbacks emerge after a group of men seeking to come to Australia by boat is intercepted and sent to Indonesia.

title.children: Suspected asylum seeker boats intercepted and held by Border Force for 18 days, Indonesian authorities say

image.altText: Kate Lawrence stands next to a student at a circus training class

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Fringe is booming, selling more than a million tickets two years in a row. But some performers are questioning whether the festival has become too big — leaving local shows lost in the crowd.

title.children: Veteran performer quits Adelaide Fringe, saying it's now 'financially unviable' for independent artists

image.altText: A close up image of a white and orange crab

props.synopsis: Thousands of bright orange giant spider crabs have made a surprise appearance in waters off South Australia's Eyre Peninsula. A researcher is asking the community to log sightings online to help scientists learn more about the species.

title.children: 'Sight to behold': Giant spider crabs gathering near in SA baffles locals and experts

image.altText: A Caucasian woman wearing red lipstick, winged eyeliner and a red round hat smiles in a selfie

props.synopsis: The Irish prime minister says he will intervene to help a 28-year-old flight attendant detained in Dubai under "the most appalling of circumstances".

title.children: UAE detains Irish woman on charges of trying to take her own life

image.altText: A row of guns lined up in a collector's home.

props.synopsis: Farmers and recreational shooters say they've been labelled as "bad people" following recent changes to WA's firearms legislation, which will come into effect in March 2025.

title.children: Gun owners feel victimised by new WA firearms laws, touted as 'toughest' in the country

image.altText: Naarah poses sidewards to camera, smiling, with her hands up together wearing gloves in London

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Actor Naarah answers all the money questions we don't like to talk about as we seek to demystify personal finance and normalise conversations about how we think about money, what we earn and how we spend it.

title.children: 'I've been saving at least $2 a week since I was little': The money habits that allowed Naarah to buy a house in her 20s

image.altText: Lia and Bella

props.synopsis: This service allows commuters to report anti-social behaviour and sexual assault on public transport. But does it make women feel safer?

title.children: 'No-one was going to help me': Lia was on a tram when a man's behaviour left her feeling 'incredibly vulnerable'

image.altText: Man wearing sunglasses in front of the ocean

props.synopsis: Geraldton man Matthew Watson had a bad feeling when his friend didn't return to the boat during a spearfishing trip near Coral Bay on Monday. Then, he spotted him bleeding in the water.

title.children: 'I've been hit': Man describes pulling mate bitten by shark from waters off remote WA coast

image.altText: A close up of Joe Biden speaking passionately and pointing with his right hand

props.synopsis: Joe Biden has given his highest-profile policy speech since his halting debate performance sparked speculation about his fitness for office. Here are the key moments from his NATO address.

title.children: Ukraine will stop Putin, Biden tells NATO in forceful speech

image.altText: A swampy shallow creek with trees around.

props.synopsis: Police say the crocodile was shot by local rangers on Sunday then resurfaced on Tuesday, when it was confirmed to be the animal that attacked the girl.

title.children: 4.2m crocodile that killed 12-year-old girl shot dead in remote NT

image.altText: Filicide study

props.synopsis: About 20 children are murdered by a parent every year in Australia. It's a crime that evokes equal measures of horror and confusion. At the crux of the issue is male-perpetrated violence.

title.children: The psychology behind filicide — explaining the unexplainable

image.altText: Ripening Chardonnay grapes in South Australia's Riverland

props.synopsis: More chardonnay grapes were crushed across Australia in the past year than any other variety, pushing the country's white grape crush ahead of red for the first time in a decade.

title.children: White wine on rise as chardonnay tops shiraz to be Australia's most popular variety

image.altText: Luna is smiling at the camera and holding a toy unicorn

props.synopsis: Australian children with a rare form of cancer known as neuroblastoma will no longer need to spend $500,000 and travel to the US for treatment, as the federal government agrees to cover costs immediately while the drug gets local approvals.

title.children: Children with rare cancer given free access to treatment at home, after previously being forced to travel to US for $500,000 drug

image.altText: a brown kelpie staring up at the camera while being pet by an elderly lady's hand

props.synopsis: The energy in the room shifts when visitors walk through the doors of a regional SA aged care facility with their tails in the air and ears perked.

title.children: Nursing home residents 'light up' as dogs find way to their hearts

image.altText: A woman in a pink jumper reads to a small child.

props.synopsis: Living in a childcare desert has meant Sarah and Jacob Vlatko have had to devise a creative work schedule to care for their toddler, but they're concerned it will have flow-on effects for her superannuation.

title.children: Without access to childcare, Sarah is one of thousands of mums whose superannuation is taking a hit

image.altText: A woman with grey hair wearing a check jacket and pearls

props.synopsis: South Australia's anti-corruption commissioner has quit saying she has "run out of steam" after the state's integrity laws were watered down nearly three years ago.

title.children: 'My words have fallen on deaf ears': ICAC boss quits after reforms 'damaged' SA's integrity scheme

image.altText: A drawing showing men in a lifeboat rowing through large waves away from a ship

props.synopsis: The story of the state's oldest colonial shipwreck is being re-imagined in a museum exhibit that allows history buffs to see it through the eyes of divers, as well as visitors on board while it was still intact in 1837.

title.children: Long-lost South Australian shipwreck comes to life through comic book art and virtual reality

image.altText: A close-up of Alec Baldwin's face, looking solemn and away from camera, wearing thick glasses, grey hair

props.synopsis: Getting chosen for the trial of a major Hollywood star is unusual even in Los Angeles, but it is essentially unheard of in Santa Fe, New Mexico, where Alec Baldwin will face trial over the shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on a film set.

title.children: The 12 jurors who will decide Alec Baldwin's fate have been chosen. Here's what we know so far

image.altText: A woman in chef's attire.

props.synopsis: A man accused of killing his 85-year-old wife at their home in Adelaide's west has been committed to the state's highest court to stand trial, despite not entering a plea to murder.

title.children: Family 'disappointed and distraught' after accused wife killer granted bail

image.altText: The prime minister shakes the hand of a young woman

props.synopsis: Being nominated for Australian of the Year is one of the most rewarding experiences, as SA's Tiahni Adamson can attest. With nominations closing at the end of the month, those working behind the scenes offer a glimpse into the long process of choosing an overall winner.

title.children: Choosing between 'everyday Australians doing extraordinary things' is no easy feat for those running our national awards

image.altText: A blue coloured T logo with an orange oval mounted on a fake grass wall

props.synopsis: The telecommunications company faces an ACMA directive to correct an error which led to more than 140,000 customer records being made public, despite those customers paying for their information to remain unlisted.

title.children: ACMA issues directive to Telstra after massive privacy breach of unlisted numbers

image.altText: A man with his head bandaged and a pained expression sits on a hospital floor next to a young boy

props.synopsis: Palestinian officials say an Israeli air strike in southern Gaza has killed dozens of people while advancing tanks in Gaza City forced residents to flee under fire as Israel stepped up an offensive that Hamas warned could jeopardise ceasefire talks.

title.children: 'Gaza City is being wiped out': Residents flee under fire as Israeli tanks advance in renewed campaign

image.altText: People walking past a Westpac sign.

props.synopsis: Privacy laws are restricting banks' abilities to effectively deal with cases of financial abuse, Australia's second-largest bank has told a federal inquiry.

title.children: Privacy laws preventing bank from adequately addressing financial abuse, Westpac representatives say

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair with red lipstick on

props.synopsis: The Kremlin issues arrest warrant for Yulia Navalnaya, who has been living in exile since the death of her late husband Alexei Navalny in a Russian penal colony earlier this year.

title.children: Russia orders arrest of jailed opposition leader's widow Yulia Navalnaya

image.altText: New research examines prevalence of sexual violence perpetration in Australia

props.synopsis: A new study finds "shocking" levels of perpetrating sexual violence among Australians aged 18 to 45, with men the main offenders.

title.children: 1 in 5 Australians admit to perpetrating acts of sexual violence, from harassing someone for a date to sexual assault

image.altText: a selfie of a man, Luke Smith. He is wearing a red cap

props.synopsis: Luke Smith's family say the compassion and willingness of searchers since the 23-year-old went missing at Lake Macquarie has provided them with strength and hope.

title.children: Family holds hope for man missing from overturned tinny as search scaled back

image.altText: A bespectacled man with a grey goatee wears a blue top as he sits with his arms on a table in front of him.

props.synopsis: Within a year of landing her first full-time teaching job, Oh Jae Geun's daughter took her own life after overzealous parents ruthlessly scrutinised her performance and threatened to make criminal complaints to the police.

title.children: Oh Jae Geun's daughter was a teacher. After her death, he found shocking stories about parents in her phone

image.altText: A composite image of a large penguin on a beach

props.synopsis: While the presence of two sizeable pieces of plastic in the bird's stomach were concerning, its cause of death was most likely a dog or fox attack.

title.children: King penguin's rare SA sojourn ends in animal attack

image.altText: A star which looks like a firework.

props.synopsis: A spectacular nova may be about to light up our night sky in the constellation Corona Borealis. If it does, Australians will only have a short window to catch it.

title.children: If predictions are right, we could see an exploding star on the horizon soon

image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a beanie squatting in the sun in front of a red building

props.synopsis: As Alice Springs approaches its third and potentially final night of a snap 72-hour curfew, frontline services say they're deeply concerned for those sleeping rough.

title.children: Alice Springs curfew targeting crime exposes underlying homelessness crisis, services say

image.altText: Lamine Yamal slides on his knees as he celebrates a goal for Spain against France at Euro 2024.

props.synopsis: Teenager Lamine Yamal helps Spain come from behind to defeat France 2-1, with the three-time champions now waiting to play either England or the Netherlands in the tournament decider.

title.children: Spain beats France to reach Euro 2024 final as 16yo creates football history
